message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is about end-to-end speech recognition using a joint CTC-attention model within the multi-task learning framework. The paper discusses the use of attention-based encoder-decoder framework and Connectionist Temporal Classification (CTC) for end-to-end speech recognition. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) which deals with natural language processing and speech recognition. The paper also discusses the use of multi-task learning, which falls under cs.SD (Sound) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses a purely data-driven method, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
